Package game

Class Game

java.lang.Object
game.Game
public class Game extends Object
FlossTAGE (Text Adventure Game Engine) - A game system for the development of simple text adventure games in Java. This class contains global game data structures and numerous utility methods (particularly for I/O).
Version:
beta (2022)
Author:
J Adam Fischbach

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    static final boolean
    CONSOLE
    Is the game a console application? If false, the game will compile as a GUI application.
    static final String
    DEVELOPER
    Developer name.
    static final boolean
    TEXT_DATA_FILES
    Import data from raw text files? If false, the game will import data from obscured data files.
    static final String
    TITLE
    Game title.
    static final String
    VERSION
    Version number.

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      Launches the game!

    • print

      public static void print(String s)
      Standard game output method. Prints the given message.
      Parameters:
      s - message to print

    • println

      public static void println(String s)
      Same as print() but does not add a blank line after printing the given message. For typical game output, use print().
      Parameters:
      s - message to print

    • convoResponseGUI

      public static void convoResponseGUI(game.NPC character, int convoOptions)
      Alerts GameGUI that the next command entered by the user is the response to a NPC dialog prompt.
      Parameters:
      character - NPC engaged in dialog with the player
      convoOptions - number of potential player responses

    • getYesNo

      public static char getYesNo(String prompt)
      Prompts the player for a Yes/No response. For GUI applications, this will open a dialog box. For console applications, this method does not verify user input.
      Parameters:
      prompt - prompt to display to player
      Returns:
      player's response

    • getInt

      public static int getInt(Object prompt) throws game.CancelledInputException
      Prompts the player to enter a number. Will ensure player enters a number (unless cancelled).
      Parameters:
      prompt - prompt to display to player
      Returns:
      number entered by player
      Throws:
      game.CancelledInputException - if player clicks Cancel (GUI only)

    • getInt

      public static int getInt(Object prompt, String title) throws game.CancelledInputException
      Prompts the player to enter a number. Will ensure player enters a number (unless cancelled).
      Parameters:
      prompt - prompt to display to player
      title - title for dialog box (GUI only)
      Returns:
      number entered by player
      Throws:
      game.CancelledInputException - if player clicks Cancel (GUI only)

    • endGame

      public static void endGame()
      Ends the game.

    • getCurrentRoom

      public static game.Room getCurrentRoom()
      Returns the room the player is currently in.
      Returns:
      current room

    • setCurrentRoom

      public static void setCurrentRoom(game.Room r)
      Sets the current room to the given room. This essentially "moves" the player to the given room.
      Parameters:
      r - room player will move to

    • setCurrentRoom

      public static void setCurrentRoom(String label)
      Sets the current room to the room with the given label. This essentially "moves" the player to the given room.
      Parameters:
      label - label of room player will move to

    • addFlag

      public static void addFlag(String flag)
      Adds the given status flag to the list of global game flags. This can be used to indicate that some event has occurred in the game.
      Parameters:
      flag - name of flag

    • addFlag

      public static void addFlag(String flag, int value)
      Adds or updates the given status flag with the given value to the list of global game flags. If flag has already been added, this will update the flag's value. This can be used to add or update an attribute for the player, for example.
      Parameters:
      flag - name of flag/attribute
      value - value of attribute

    • getFlag

      public static int getFlag(String flag)
      Returns the specified flag's (or attribute's) value.
      Parameters:
      flag - name of flag/attribute
      Returns:
      flag's value

    • hasFlag

      public static boolean hasFlag(String flag)
      Returns true if the specified flag exists.
      Parameters:
      flag - name of flag
      Returns:
      true if flag exists

    • addSimpleItem

      public static void addSimpleItem(String name, String desc)
      Adds the given simple item and item description to the global list of simple items. A "simple item" is an item that the player can look at but not otherwise interact with.
      Parameters:
      name - name of simple item
      desc - item description

    • getRoom

      public static game.Room getRoom(String label)
      Returns the room with the specified label.
      Parameters:
      label - label of room
      Returns:
      room object

    • help

      public static void help()
      Displays the list of general player commands.

    • itemHelp

      public static void itemHelp()
      Displays the list of commands player can use with items.

    • npcHelp

      public static void npcHelp()
      Displays the list of commands player can use with NPCs.
